Description¶

Operate on registered shading nodes in Maya.

Shading Groups¶

Are nodes with a type identifier of 'shadingEngine'. They provide an interface for applying connected shaders to connected surface geometry members using the following setup:

shaders ⟶ shading group
members ⟶ shading group

They are a type of set node sometimes referred to as renderable sets which use the same setup as object sets:

member ⟶ set ⟶ partition

  • Partitions define a collection of mutually exclusive sets.
  • Members (instances/components) of one set cannot connect to another set in the same partition.

Any surface geometry that requires shading in the viewport or a render engine must be connected to a shading group as a member. Members can be applied as either surface instances or a selection of components for a surface instance.

Shaders¶

Provide shading data for shading group members. They are commonly referred to as materials.

There are three categories of shaders which interface with shading groups as follows:

  1. Surface Shaders - Connect to the 'surfaceShader' plug of a shading group.
  2. Volume Shaders - Connect to the 'volumeShader' plug of a shading group.
  3. Displacement Shaders - Connect to the 'displacementShader' plug of a shading group.

Third party rendering packages usually provide custom materials which interface with shading groups in a similiar way.

Textures¶

Provide texture data for shaders.

Creation¶

Shading nodes should not be created using cmds.createNode() or OpenMaya.MDGModifier.createNode(). Maya provides commands which ensure shading nodes are registered upon creation:

  • cmds.sets(): Allows for creation of shading groups. Ensures each shading group is registered with the default 'renderPartition' and 'lightLinker1' nodes.
  • cmds.shadingNode(): Allows for creation of shaders and textures. Ensures each shader is registered with the 'defaultShaderList1' node. Ensures each texture is registered with the 'defaultTextureList1' node.
msTools.core.maya.shader_utils.addMembersToShadingGroup(memberSelection, shadingGroup, force=False)¶

Add surface node components and instances to a shading group.

Note

If any of the memberSelection components or instances are already assigned to a shading group, force must be True. The components of each memberSelection element will be removed from their current shading group and assigned to shadingGroup.

Parameters:
  • memberSelection (OpenMaya.MSelectionList) – Selection containing surface node components and instances to add to shadingGroup. Each element must be retrievable via OpenMaya.MSelectionList.getDagPath().
  • shadingGroup (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a shading group node.
  • force (bool) – Whether to force the member assignment of memberSelection elements to shadingGroup. If an element is already a member of a shading group it is necessary to set this True. Defaults to False.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If shadingGroup does not reference a shading group node.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If memberSelection contains elements which do not reference a surface node.
  • RuntimeError – If memberSelection contains an element which is already a member of a shading group and force is False.
msTools.core.maya.shader_utils.createShader(shaderType='lambert', memberSelection=None, force=False)¶

Create a new shader and shading group network. Assign surface node components and instances as members.

Provides the ability to create shader networks which are built using the same behaviour as the Create Render Node interface.

Parameters:
  • shaderType (basestring, optional) – Shader node type identifier. Defaults to 'lambert'.
  • memberSelection (OpenMaya.MSelectionList) – Selection containing surface node components and instances to add to the new shading group. Each element must be retrievable via OpenMaya.MSelectionList.getDagPath().
  • force (bool) – Whether to force the member assignment of memberSelection elements to the new shading group. If an element is already a member of a shading group it is necessary to set this True. Defaults to False.
Raises:
  • ValueError – If shaderType is not a valid shader node type identifier.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If memberSelection contains elements which do not reference a surface node.
  • RuntimeError – If memberSelection contains an element which is already a member of a shading group and force is False.
Returns:

(OpenMaya.MObject, OpenMaya.MObject) – A two-element tuple.

  1. Wrapper of the new shader node.
  2. Wrapper of the new shading group node.
msTools.core.maya.shader_utils.deleteUnusedShadingNodes(shadingGroups=False, shaders=False, textures=False)¶

Delete unused non-default shading nodes.

Note

An unused shading node is defined as any registered shading node which is not currently influencing the shading of geometry. For example an unused shading group is one which has no members.

Parameters:
  • shadingGroups (bool, optional) – Whether to delete unused shading group nodes. Defaults to False.
  • shaders (bool, optional) – Whether to delete unused shader nodes. Defaults to False.
  • textures (bool, optional) – Whether to delete unused texture and placement nodes. Defaults to False.
msTools.core.maya.shader_utils.getDefaultShadingGroup()¶
Returns:OpenMaya.MObject – Default shading group.
msTools.core.maya.shader_utils.getDefaultSurfaceShader()¶
Returns:OpenMaya.MObject – Default shader.
msTools.core.maya.shader_utils.getMembersFromShadingGroup(shadingGroup)¶

Return members of a shading group.

Parameters:shadingGroup (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a shading group node.
Raises:msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If shadingGroup does not reference a shading group node.
Returns:(OpenMaya.MSelectionList, (bool, …)) – A two-element tuple.
  1. Contains the members of shadingGroup.
  2. tuple of bool values for each member in the OpenMaya.MSelectionList.
    • A False value indicates the member is an OpenMaya.MDagPath.
    • A True value indicates the member is an (OpenMaya.MDagPath, OpenMaya.MObject) component tuple.
msTools.core.maya.shader_utils.getShaderNodeTypes()¶
Returns:list [str] – Shader node type identifiers.
msTools.core.maya.shader_utils.getTextureNodeTypes()¶
Returns:list [str] – Texture node type identifiers.
msTools.core.maya.shader_utils.hasMembers(shadingGroup)¶
Parameters:shadingGroup (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a shading group node.
Raises:msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If shadingGroup does not reference a shading group node.
Returns:bool – True if shadingGroup has members.
msTools.core.maya.shader_utils.isComponentMember(component, shadingGroup, allowSubset=False)¶

Check if a component selection is a member or sub-member of a shading group.

Note

This method only checks the component members of shadingGroup. Use isSurfaceMember() to complete a broader check of whether a surface node is connected to shadingGroup via any of its member.

Parameters:
  • component ((OpenMaya.MDagPath, OpenMaya.MObject)) –

    A two-element tuple representing component data.

    1. Path encapsulation of a surface node.
    2. Wrapper of a component object holding data of type OpenMaya.MFn.kComponent.
  • shadingGroup (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a shading group node.
  • allowSubset (bool) – Whether component should be considered a member if its elements represent a subset of a member assigned to shadingGroup. Defaults to False.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If shadingGroup does not reference a shading group node.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If component does not provide surface node component data.
Returns:

bool – True if one of the following conditions is met:

  1. component represents a subset of component elements for a member assigned to shadingGroup and allowSubset is True.
  2. component represents the exact component elements of a member assigned to shadingGroup.

Otherwise False.
msTools.core.maya.shader_utils.isSurfaceMember(surfacePath, shadingGroup)¶

Check if a path to a surface node is connected to a shading group via any of its members.

Note

This method checks all connections from surfacePath to shadingGroup regardless of whether surfacePath is connected via a component list. Use isComponentMember() to check if specific components are assigned to shadingGroup.

Parameters:
  • surfacePath (OpenMaya.MDagPath) – Path encapsulation of a surface node.
  • shadingGroup (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a shading group node.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If surfacePath does not reference a surface node.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If shadingGroup does not reference a shading group node.
Returns:

bool – True if surfacePath is connected to shadingGroup via any of its members, otherwise False.
msTools.core.maya.shader_utils.iterShaders(default=True, user=True, used=True, unused=True)¶

Yield shader nodes from the scene.

Note

Only registered shaders will be generated. A registered shader is one which is connected to 'defaultShaderList1'.

At least one parameter must be True from each pair of filter options:

  • Filter shaders based on creation: default, user.
  • Filter shaders based on usage: used, unused.
Parameters:
  • default (bool, optional) – Whether to include default shaders (ie. 'lambert1', 'particleCloud1'). Defaults to True.
  • user (bool, optional) – Whether to include user created shaders. Defaults to True.
  • used (bool, optional) – Whether to include shaders which are currently being used to shade geometry. Meaning any shader which is connected upstream of a shading group that has members. Defaults to True.
  • unused (bool, optional) – Whether to include shaders which are not currently being used to shade geometry. Meaning any shader which is not connected to a shading group or is connected to one which has no members. Defaults to True.
Raises:

ValueError – If there is not at least one True parameter for each pair of filter options.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MObject – Wrappers of shader nodes for the given parameters.
msTools.core.maya.shader_utils.iterShadersFromGeometry(surfacePath, default=True, user=True, allInstances=False)¶

Yield shaders influencing the shading of a surface node.

Note

Only registered shaders will be generated. A registered shader is one which is connected to 'defaultShaderList1'.

At least one parameter must be True from the following pair of filter options:

  • Filter shaders based on creation: default, user.
Parameters:
  • surfacePath (OpenMaya.MDagPath) – Path to a surface node.
  • default (bool, optional) – Whether to include default shaders influencing the shading of surfacePath (eg. 'lambert1', 'particleCloud1'). Defaults to True.
  • user (bool, optional) – Whether to include user created shaders influencing the shading of surfacePath. Defaults to True.
  • allInstances (bool, optional) – Whether to search all instances of the node referenced by surfacePath for shaders influencing their shading. Defaults to False.
Raises:
  • ValueError – If there is not at least one True parameter for the pair of filter options.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If surfacePath does not reference a surface node.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MObject – Wrappers of shader nodes influencing the shading of surfacePath for the given parameters.
msTools.core.maya.shader_utils.iterShadersFromShadingGroup(shadingGroup, default=True, user=True)¶

Yield shaders connected to a shading group node.

Note

Only registered shaders will be generated. A registered shader is one which is connected to 'defaultShaderList1'.

At least one parameter must be True from the following pair of filter options:

  • Filter shaders based on creation: default, user.
Parameters:
  • shadingGroup (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a shading group node.
  • default (bool, optional) – Whether to include default shaders connected to shadingGroup (eg. 'lambert1', 'particleCloud1'). Defaults to True.
  • user (bool, optional) – Whether to include user created shaders connected to shadingGroup. Defaults to True.
Raises:
  • ValueError – If there is not at least one True parameter for the pair of filter options.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If shadingGroup does not reference a shading group node.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MObject – Wrappers of shader nodes connected to shadingGroup for the given parameters.
msTools.core.maya.shader_utils.iterShadingGroups(default=True, user=True, used=True, unused=True)¶

Yield shading group nodes from the scene.

Note

At least one parameter must be True from each pair of filter options:

  • Filter shading groups based on creation: default, user.
  • Filter shading groups based on usage: used, unused.
Parameters:
  • default (bool, optional) – Whether to include default shading groups (ie. 'initialShadingGroup', 'initialParticleSE'). Defaults to True.
  • user (bool, optional) – Whether to include user created shading groups. Defaults to True.
  • used (bool, optional) – Whether to include shading groups which have members. Defaults to True.
  • unused (bool, optional) – Whether to include shading groups which do not have members. Defaults to True.
Raises:

ValueError – If there is not at least one True parameter for each pair of filter options.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MObject – Wrappers of shading group nodes for the given parameters.
msTools.core.maya.shader_utils.iterShadingGroupsFromGeometry(surfacePath, default=True, user=True, allInstances=False)¶

Yield shading groups connected to a surface node.

Note

At least one parameter must be True from the following pair of filter options:

  • Filter shading groups based on creation: default, user.
Parameters:
  • surfacePath (OpenMaya.MDagPath) – Path to a surface node.
  • default (bool, optional) – Whether to include default shading groups connected to surfacePath (eg. 'initialShadingGroup', 'initialParticleSE'). Defaults to True.
  • user (bool, optional) – Whether to include user created shading groups connected to surfacePath. Defaults to True.
  • allInstances (bool, optional) – Whether to search all instances of the node referenced by surfacePath for connected shading groups. Defaults to False.
Raises:
  • ValueError – If there is not at least one True parameter for the pair of filter options.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If surfacePath does not reference a surface node.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MObject – Wrappers of shading group nodes connected to surfacePath for the given parameters.
msTools.core.maya.shader_utils.iterTextures(used=True, unused=True, includePlacementNodes=True)¶

Yield texture nodes and there connected placement nodes from the scene.

Note

Only registered textures and there connected placement nodes will be generated. A registered texture is one which is connected to 'defaultTextureList1'.

At least one parameter must be True from the following pair of filter options:

  • Filter textures based on usage: used, unused.
Parameters:
  • used (bool, optional) – Whether to include textures which are currently being used to shade geometry. Meaning any texture which is connected upstream of a shading group that has members. Defaults to True.
  • unused (bool, optional) – Whether to include textures which are not currently being used to shade geometry. Meaning any texture which is not connected upstream of a shading group or is connected upstream of one which has no members. Defaults to True.
  • includePlacementNodes (bool, optional) – Whether to also generate placement nodes (eg. place2dTexture) that are connected to resulting textures. Defaults to True.
Raises:

ValueError – If there is not at least one True parameter for each pair of filter options.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MObject – Wrappers of texture nodes and their connected placement nodes for the given parameters.
msTools.core.maya.shader_utils.iterTexturesFromGeometry(surfacePath, allInstances=False, includePlacementNodes=True)¶

Yield textures connected upstream of a surface node.

Note

Only registered textures and there connected placement nodes will be generated. A registered texture is one which is connected to 'defaultTextureList1'.

Parameters:
  • surfacePath (OpenMaya.MDagPath) – Path to a surface node.
  • allInstances (bool, optional) – Whether to search all instances of the node referenced by surfacePath for textures influencing their shading. Defaults to False.
  • includePlacementNodes (bool, optional) – Whether to also generate placement nodes (eg. place2dTexture) that are connected to resulting textures. Defaults to True.
Raises:

msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If surfacePath does not reference a surface node.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MObject – Wrappers of texture nodes influencing the shading of surfacePath and their connected placement nodes.
msTools.core.maya.shader_utils.iterTexturesFromShader(shader, includePlacementNodes=True)¶

Yield textures connected to a shader node.

Note

Only registered textures and there connected placement nodes will be generated. A registered texture is one which is connected to 'defaultTextureList1'.

Parameters:
  • shader (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a shader node.
  • includePlacementNodes (bool, optional) – Whether to also generate placement nodes (eg. place2dTexture) that are connected to resulting textures. Defaults to True.
Raises:

msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If shader does not reference a dependency node.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MObject – Wrappers of texture nodes connected to shader and their connected placement nodes.
msTools.core.maya.shader_utils.iterTexturesFromShadingGroup(shadingGroup, includePlacementNodes=True)¶

Yield textures connected upstream of a shading group node.

Note

Only registered textures and there connected placement nodes will be generated. A registered texture is one which is connected to 'defaultTextureList1'.

Parameters:
  • shadingGroup (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a shading group node.
  • includePlacementNodes (bool, optional) – Whether to also generate placement nodes (eg. place2dTexture) that are connected to resulting textures. Defaults to True.
Raises:

msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If shadingGroup does not reference a shading group node.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MObject – Wrappers of texture nodes connected upstream of shadingGroup and their connected placement nodes.
msTools.core.maya.shader_utils.removeMembersFromAllShadingGroups(memberSelection)¶

Remove surface node components and instances from all connected shading groups.

Note

If a memberSelection element represents the components of a surface node instance, any intersecting components of any shading group member will be removed. If a memberSelection element represents a surface node instance, any shading group member of that instance will also be removed.

Parameters:memberSelection (OpenMaya.MSelectionList) – Selection containing surface node components and instances to remove from any connected shading groups. Each element must be retrievable via OpenMaya.MSelectionList.getDagPath().
Raises:msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If memberSelection contains elements which do not reference a surface node.
msTools.core.maya.shader_utils.removeMembersFromShadingGroup(memberSelection, shadingGroup)¶

Remove surface node components and instances from a shading group.

Note

If a memberSelection element represents the components of a surface node instance, any intersecting components of any shadingGroup member will be removed. If a memberSelection element represents a surface node instance, any shadingGroup member of that instance will also be removed.

Parameters:
  • memberSelection (OpenMaya.MSelectionList) – Selection containing surface node components and instances to remove from shadingGroup. Each element must be retrievable via OpenMaya.MSelectionList.getDagPath().
  • shadingGroup (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a shading group node.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If shadingGroup does not reference a shading group node.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If memberSelection contains elements which do not reference a surface node.
